subject: Earth System Modeling / Machine Learning
title: Machine Learning in Earth System Modeling (TUM, Module ED110065)
description: Data-driven and process-based modeling of the Earth system: differential-equation models, linear/nonlinear/parametric/nonparametric approaches, inverse/data-driven modeling, RNNs/CNNs for dynamics, explainable and interpretable AI. Workload 90 h (30 h contact), 3 ECTS, offered each semester. Version 2022w responsible: Boers, Niklas.

goals.title: Machine Learning in Earth System Modeling – Module Overview
goals.description: Students understand foundations of Earth-system modeling and ML methods for dynamics, including explainable AI and hybrid process/data-driven modeling.
goals.titleEn: Machine Learning in Earth System Modeling – Module Overview
goals.descriptionEn: Students understand foundations of Earth-system modeling and ML methods for dynamics, including explainable AI and hybrid process/data-driven modeling.

goals.title: Process-Based Modeling Foundations
goals.description: Learner can explain classical process-based Earth-system modeling with differential equations and linear/nonlinear, parametric/nonparametric approaches.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain classical process-based Earth-system modeling with differential equations and linear/nonlinear, parametric/nonparametric approaches.

goals.title: Inverse and Data-Driven Modeling
goals.description: Learner can describe inverse modeling and data-driven approaches for Earth-system components.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can describe inverse modeling and data-driven approaches for Earth-system components.

goals.title: Neural Networks for Dynamics
goals.description: Learner can apply recurrent and convolutional neural networks to dynamic modeling tasks in Earth-system contexts.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can apply recurrent and convolutional neural networks to dynamic modeling tasks in Earth-system contexts.

goals.title: Explainable and Interpretable AI
goals.description: Learner can explain XAI methods and use them to identify Earth-system dynamics in neural models.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain XAI methods and use them to identify Earth-system dynamics in neural models.

goals.title: Hybrid Process/ML Modeling
goals.description: Learner can understand and critically assess combinations of process-based and data-driven/ML models for Earth-system dynamics.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can understand and critically assess combinations of process-based and data-driven/ML models for Earth-system dynamics.

titleEn: Machine Learning in Earth System Modeling (TUM, Module ED110065)
descriptionEn: Data-driven and process-based modeling of the Earth system: differential-equation models, linear/nonlinear/parametric/nonparametric approaches, inverse/data-driven modeling, RNNs/CNNs for dynamics, explainable and interpretable AI. Workload 90 h (30 h contact), 3 ECTS, offered each semester. Version 2022w responsible: Boers, Niklas.
